message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.CR 

Reasoning: The paper proposes a mechanism design solution to address adverse selection and moral hazard in peer review systems. This falls under the category of game theory (cs.GT) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as it involves designing incentives for agents to exert high effort and achieve high ratings. The use of ratings to summarize past review quality also suggests a potential application in machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the potential for manipulation and collusion in peer review systems, which falls under the category of cybersecurity (cs.CR) and potentially complex systems (cs.CY).
